text: one-pan wonder anyone I know the answer

nasty
the first thing you need to do is cut up
an apple cut into 1-inch chunks aprox
you do not need to peel it I'm saving

perfect for this much better than a
roasting pan so make sure you have a
rimmed baking sheet 2 stalks of celery
these should be cut up I like to divide
the end half in half lengthwise and then
leave the top part whole you might want
to trim the ends off a little bit and
then just cut them crosswise into you
know half inch pieces we're basically
making an apple stuffing but we're
roasting it on the pan and then putting
the chicken on top of it and then add
that to your tray with your apple you
know what makes it stuffing bread 9
ounces of crusty bread it can totally be
day-old leave the crust on for nice
texture and just cut it into big chunks
like 2 inch chunks wait till you see
what happens in the oven they get crisp
and then you add some stock and they get
a little soft and a little crispy make
sure it's nice and even on the tray
drizzle with a tablespoon of olive oil
not very much and add a teaspoon of
caraway seed mmm that's really fragrant
season it with salt and pepper and give
it a toss
if you're not on a diet you can go ahead

if you're watching your fat you can

degrees for 10 minutes okay after 10

add your chicken stock and then one
